intro: Egenolfia bipinnatifida, commonly known as the narrow-leafed ironwood, is a member of the Rutaceae family. It is a shrub or small tree native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa. The plant is characterized by its bipinnatifid leaves, which are finely divided and give it a feathery appearance. It produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are often clustered in inflorescences. The plant is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, showing resilience to drought conditions.
